body.p:
To His Excellency James F Robinson
Governor of Kentucky

Your Petitioner Bridget Kearney would most respectfully say that she was fined in the City Court of Louisville seventy five dollars on two several Indictments for alleged assaults & Batteries both having occurred on the same difficulty -- She is a widow with two children of her own and an orphan child she is Rearing --

She observed at her own door a fight among some Irishmen when a young man was engaged, that had previously been badly wounded, and the same was about being beaten by these men -- She very naturally took part with this young man ^who^ was a cripple and an acquaintance of her former husband -- One of the Irishmen was roughly handled and she was blamed for it.

She was fined $50 -- on one Indictment & $25 -- on the other -- She is a widow supporting three children and is destitute of any property save & except household furniture and that very scanty. She will be compelled to go to the workhouse if these fines are not remitted. She prays your Excellency to
remit these fines -- The men who were beaten were stout ablebodied Irishmen & she an Irish woman. She refers to names below for recommendation as to character and standing --
We whose names are hereto signed nor acquaintanced with Mrs Kearney, and urgently request your Excellency to remit her fines --

A Loeser ,
Jas Juerry

I am acquainted with the persons who have signed the foregoing Petition, they are all Citizens of Louisville, The Petitioner Mrs Kearney is a Widow & has two or three children, her means I know are limited

Geo. W. Johnston Judge
City Court Louisville
WeI corroborate with the Judge in his statement

W R Hydes Marshall
Phil Tomppert Jr
Baird & Price
Att at Law
H. Seaton

Am unacquainted with Mrs Kearney, petitioner, but feel sure Judge Johnston & other signers only ask what it would be proper to grant to a widow with children to support
